tripreview.Title: "Stunning Views !"
tripreview.Userloc: Ras Al Khaimah, United Arab Emirates
tripreview.sentence: The location itself is fantastic, clouds below you and sometimes coming into the view point itself.
Poor FandB facilities, just a shack selling tea and some small snacks.
But excellent space for parking.
Absolutely stunning !

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful!"
tripreview.sentence: From Lock heart gap, you get the best view of the integration of the tea plantations with the untouched mountains.
The mist that rises from here is another beautiful view.
And the best part?
It is absolutely free.
The gap is located right in the National Highway and therefore you don't have to travel a lot just to see it.
Must see place in Munnar.

tripreview.sentence: The panoramic view of Lock Heart Gap is outstanding and whcih makes every tourists to stop there car here on the way to Mattupetty.

tripreview.sentence: As beautiful as rest of the other places in Munnar.

tripreview.Title: "GOOD PLACE WITH MINDBLOWING VIEWS"
tripreview.sentence: Lock hear gap is a nice place on the Highway road.

dont forget to see the Kurinji flower on the mountain wall.

tripreview.Title: "View point with clouds"
tripreview.sentence: This is on road view point and can see beautiful view only if no clouds are there.
Not much of importance to be here except it is on route to Thekkady.

tripreview.Title: "an adventerous drive through the narrow road - you will just love it"
tripreview.sentence: Lockhart Gap (often spelt wrongly as Lock Heart Gap) is about13 km from Munnar, is an ideal place for adventure tourism and trekking.
Numerous trekking trails, from short ones to long ones, are an attractive feature of the hill station.
Lockhart Gap is one such point in Munnar known for its winding trails leading to scenic heights, the fresh mountain air, the mist-clad hills and panoramic view make it worthy of a visit.
Also, Lockhart Gap offers some amazing views of the blue hills covered with lush greenery and silver brooks splashing the emerald greenery with white streaks.
The hygienic climate and scenic surroundings make it one of the most preferred locations to visit in Munnar.
The hilltops here offer some amazing sights of valleys and plantations.
And the sights would be much prettier during evenings when the whole surroundings get illuminated in the orange glow.
The most thrilling is the drive through the narrow road and if like adventrous driving, this is the right place.
The last time when we were on our way to Mattupetty the whole area was covered with mist and it was really awesome.

tripreview.Title: "Average Spot"
tripreview.sentence: On the way you can visit this place, you can locate this spot on Madhurai road from Munnar, Scenery was good nothing much to see though.

tripreview.Title: "Gap view point."
tripreview.sentence: In between Munnar to Chinnakanal the ghat road is calling gap road.
A view point is an attraction for tourist.
there is a tunnel where "malaikallan" stay there.

tripreview.Title: "Breathtaking view"
tripreview.sentence: very beautiful location!
green tea plantations all around.

travel in a cab to all the lovely stops in Munnar, all are equally beautiful!

tripreview.sentence: Excellent place for photo shoot

it is worth.

it was a wonderful experience.

tripreview.Title: "The fabulous tea estate"
tripreview.sentence: You are surrounded by lush green tea forest .

tripreview.Title: "Lock Heart Gap"
tripreview.sentence: This is around 18 kms away from the famous Hillstation Munnar,Kreala, India.
The roads are very narrow and sometimes it gets full of mist.
If the mists is not there the view of Tea gardens is good.

tripreview.Title: "Mesmerizing"
tripreview.sentence: This place has always thrilled me.
I like to drive through this place, The roads are narrow (really narrow) and sometimes it gets misty.
So gives the chills when you drive.
The view itself is very good (if the mists not there).
There are also tea garden views.
It is really calm and wonderful.
The Lock Heart Tea factory provide tour of Tea Factory and nearby Strawberry farms.
Takes 2-3 hours but it was worth it.

tripreview.sentence: The views are spectacular and worth a stop and photo on the way between Munnar and Thekkady but not worth going there just for the view!

i really like it.

just beautiful.

tripreview.Title: "Ok place"

Can be missed.
You can visit this place if you have free time and nothing else to do.

tripreview.Title: "Beware! Highway Robber at Lock Heart Gap!"
tripreview.sentence:
As everyone has already written about the beauty and scenery, here is something new!
'

Just adjacent to the Lock heart view point, there is a board which says that there has been a thief who lived in a rock cave on the side of the road (National Highway 49) who used to rob the unwary travelers!
Attached you can see photos of the board and the notorious cave!
God knows, when he was in action.
May be a century ago!
So don't worry.
Just go ahead and have a peep in that cave!

tripreview.Title: "Buena Vista"
tripreview.sentence: It was really kind of special driving through the gap and seeing the views of the tea plantations below open up before you.
this area can become cloud covered so a bit of luck is required.

tripreview.Title: "Very good view and atmosphere"
tripreview.sentence: Very nice location for taking snaps, depending on the climate.
very good view in rains, nice location to halt and enjoy hot maggi.

tripreview.Title: "BEST VIEW OF MUNNAR"
tripreview.sentence: A must go place to touch and feel tea plants, winding roads and a best view of tea estates.

tripreview.Title: "Lots of Tourists"
tripreview.sentence: Pretty nice area and worth the visit when in Munnar.
Just as with many places though there are a lot of tourists and if you venture a little away from the main attractions the area gets very dirty.

tripreview.Title: "Amidst the clouds"
tripreview.sentence: We went to see sunrise in lock heart gap but couldn't see it as the sky was covered in clouds.
We did a impromptu trekking in the area and we were mesmerised by the beauty.
The trek was extremely light and could have been without a guide.

tripreview.Title: "Its just ok"
tripreview.sentence: While the view is fantastic, such a point is present at every hill station.
Basically, you stop on a road, look down the valley and visit some stalls nearby.
Nothing that differentiates it from points in other hill stations.
If you have a well made plan, you may skip this.

tripreview.Title: "Excellent Place"
tripreview.sentence: This is a tea processing plant and must be visited.
Their total produce is exported and not available in India except at their plant.

tripreview.Title: "A Mountain pass with no traffic"
tripreview.sentence: U see it from far.
A gap between the two lush grren hills.
Since its a river gorge u see a silver line passing thru the gap at a distance.
River meander away from the gap into the greeney of plantations at the bottom.

tripreview.Title: "Great View"
tripreview.sentence: It is a wonder of nature.
You drive through the Lockhart Gap and a wonderful valley of tea gardens opens in front of you.

tripreview.Title: "Stop by point"
tripreview.sentence: Nothing great to write about.
It is stop over point on the way to Thekkady from Munnar.

tripreview.Title: "Did not live up to expectations"
tripreview.sentence: Was it because the Nilakurinji was missing, or was it just the fa that we were tired, or the weather did not hold up?
Dunno
It was fun, the company, the mist, the beauty of the surrounds.

tripreview.Title: "Wow what a place"
tripreview.sentence: The Gap cuts through the Chokramudi (also called Shivamudi) mountain.
On one side you have the Lockhart tea estate owned by the Tatas and on other side you have a gentle slope with numerous Cardamom plantations.
Both the sides of the Shivamudi are breathtaking sites.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful Place"
tripreview.sentence: Beautiful and scary at the same time !
Built by the British this is a must visit.
One of the scariest roads man-seriously!

tripreview.Title: "Best view place of Munnar"
tripreview.sentence: This was the best view place from all the places I travelled in Sept 2014.

This is the place where I enjoyed the most in terms of view.

tripreview.Title: "Waste of time"

tripreview.Title: "A Place called Paradise"

I just was not feeling like moving out of the place and spend good 30-45 minutes clicking and clicking.
If you visit Munnar, Lockheart Valley/ Gap is a place to visit.
